source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Salvia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Salvia. In: Walsh, N.G, Entwisle, T.J., Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae, pp. 428-430. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves entire, or trifoliolate with linear entire leaflets; plants greyish from a very dense, short indumentum
Leaves toothed or deeply lobed almost to midrib; plants green
Leaves trifoliolate (sometimes the lowermost entire or 3-lobed),  the opposite pairs often appearing as whorls of 6 simple leaves
Leaves deeply lobed; hairs mostly branched
Leaves toothed; hairs simple, never branched

Leaves with margins serrate, lamina 6–20 mm wide; corolla with abaxial median lobe (lip) 6–9 mm long; prophylls narrow (1–1.3 mm long, c. 0.2 mm wide); branches with simple, antrorse eglandular hairs and subsessile hemispherical glands

Leaves with margins crenate to slightly lacerate, lamina 24–45 mm wide; corolla with abaxial median lobe (lip) 3–3.6 mm long; prophylls broad (1–1.5 mm long, 0.6–0.8 mm wide); branches with simple, short and long eglandular hairs, straight to slightly curved, and multi-celled stalked and subsessile hemispherical glands
